metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15969 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use after free in WebRTC in Google Chrome prior to 86.0.4240.75 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15969` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 86.0.4240.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 86.0.4240.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 86.0.4240.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 86.0.4240.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 86.0.4240.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

firefox - 82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
firefox-geckodriver - 82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
firefox-mozsymbols - 82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 19.10, the chromium-browser package is just a script that installs the Chromium snap tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '86.0.4240.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.5').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
